section.name: Installation
section.p: Since the EJB3 cartridge is not part of the base AndroMDA package, you need to know a few things to get started with the cartridge. This installation and configuration guide should provide enough information to get you started.

subsection.name: Requirements
subsection.p: You must have the latest Maven (currently 2.0.4) installed and configured. You can install Maven here.

If you want to build the site docs, you need to download the latest Maven 2.0.x source from https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/maven/components/branches/maven-2.0.x and follow the instructions to build, assemble and set your M2_HOME and PATH variables.

You need to have an instance of AndroMDA 3.2. At the time of writing this, 3.2 RC1 was released but the latest 3.2-SNAPSHOT from CVS contains updates to the project generator and site plugin, and is more suitable to use with the EJB3 cartridge. Follow the anonymous CVS access at AndroMDA project to checkout the latest andromda-all.

subsection.name: Getting the Cartridge
subsection.p: The first thing you need to do is checkout the latest EJB3 cartridge from CVS. Follow the anonymous CVS access at andromdaplugins project on SourceForge to checkout the latest andromda-ejb module.

subsection.name: Building the Cartridge
subsection.p: Once you have checked out the andromda-ejb3 cartridge, you can simply build it by going to the root folder of the project and running mvn.

subsection.name: Building Reports
subsection.p: To build the EJB3 cartridge site documentation requires a few extra Maven 2 plugins to be downloaded from the Maven 2 sandbox in SVN. The Maven build documentation will give you some information on how to access their SVN.

You will need to check out the following plugins from Maven sandbox.
maven-changes-plugin
maven-changelog-plugin
Once you have built them (mvn install), these plugins will reside in your local repo.

In adopting the existing AndroMDA site format for the documentation, the Maven Doxia plugin needs a patch to be applied. You can check out doxia-1.0-alpha-8 from Maven SVN and apply the patch here. It is not critical to apply this patch, but if it's not applied, the generated XHTML will not be formated correctly but still acceptable.
All other require plugins will be downloaded to your local repo if they don't already exist.
You can download the source examples used in the howto for all sections here and extract to the target/site folder of the andromda-ejb3 plugin.
